Summary of what I did and what I found

1) I checked /user/info and read Alice and Bob's account metadata to get their GitHub usernames and emails.
   - Alice: GitHub username alicemiller, email alice.miller@gmail.com
   - Bob: GitHub username bobolive

2) I attempted to invite Alice to bobolive/random_number_generation.
   - The invite operation (git_invite_collaborators) failed when executed as a non-owner with: "Only the owner can invite collaborators."
   - The repository metadata (queried after) shows a pending collaborator: 'alice.miller@gmail.com' — so an invitation for Alice to collaborate on bobolive/random_number_generation already exists (i.e., Bob has already invited Alice).

3) I logged in as Alice (login successful).
   - I confirmed Alice's GitHub account is alicemiller and that the repository shows a pending invitation for her email.

Why I could not accept the invitation on Alice's behalf
- The available toolset does not provide an API to accept a pending GitHub repository invitation for a user. I also checked Alice's linked GitHub inbox/notifications via the available functions and found no unread GitHub-linked emails that I could use to accept an invite automatically. Because of these tool limitations, I cannot programmatically click "Accept invitation" on Alice's behalf.

How you (or I) can finish this (next steps)
- The invitation is already pending. To accept it while logged in as Alice:
  1. Log into GitHub as alicemiller (alice.miller@gmail.com).
  2. Open GitHub notifications or invitations:
     - Go to https://github.com/notifications and look for the invitation, or
     - Click your profile photo -> "Your repositories" -> "Invitations" (or check the Invitations section in the UI).
  3. Find the invite for bobolive/random_number_generation and click Accept.

If you want me to help further
- I can send an email to Bob (bob.olive@gmail.com) requesting he re-send or directly add Alice if you want me to do that. I did not send any emails yet — tell me if you want me to send one and I will draft and send it.
- If you can provide a different tool/permission that allows accepting invitations via API, I can try again.

Let me know whether you want me to:
- Send Bob an email asking him to re-send or confirm the invite (I can send it now), or
- Provide a step-by-step screenshot-style walkthrough for Alice to accept the invite, or
- Anything else.
